subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 18 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Vice-chairman Dein leaves Arsenal
Arsenal vice-chairman David Dein leaves the club with immediate effect.



 
Poland and Ukraine host Euro 2012
Poland and Ukraine are chosen as joint hosts of the 2012 European Championships, as Italy surprisingly misses out.



 
Cole braced for hostile reception
Joe Cole makes his first return to West Ham on Wednesday knowing a Chelsea win could help condemn his former club.








GOLF




Ballesteros set for seniors debut
Seve Ballesteros will make his Champions Tour debut at next month's Regions Charity Classic in Birmingham, Alabama, USA.



 
Weekley clinches Heritage victory
Boo Weekley wins the Verizon Heritage by one shot from Ernie Els with two remarkable late chip-ins.



 
Lincicome battles to Florida win
Brittany Lincicome wins the LPGA Ginn Open as Laura Davies and Lorena Ochoa struggle on the final day in Florida.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton 'could become best ever'
Lewis Hamilton could go on to become the greatest racing driver of all time, his McLaren boss Martin Whitmarsh says.



 
Raikkonen rues missed opportunity
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen thinks he could have won all three Grands Prix this season.



 
Hamilton feats 'are no surprise'
Renault F1 driver Heikki Kovalainen says he expected Lewis Hamilton to star for McLaren this season.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton 'could become best ever'
Lewis Hamilton could go on to become the greatest racing driver of all time, his McLaren boss Martin Whitmarsh says.



 
Raikkonen rues missed opportunity
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen thinks he could have won all three Grands Prix this season.



 
Hamilton feats 'are no surprise'
Renault F1 driver Heikki Kovalainen says he expected Lewis Hamilton to star for McLaren this season.








ATHLETICS




Holmes set to race in Manchester
Double Olympic gold medallist Dame Kelly Holmes will take part in the Great Manchester Run.



 
O'Sullivan 11th in Dublin event
Sonia O'Sullivan has to settle for 11th place in her final road race on Irish soil in Sunday's Great BUPA Ireland Run.



 
Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.








CYCLING




O'Grady takes Paris-Roubaix glory
Stuart O'Grady becomes the first-ever Australian winner of cycling's Paris-Roubaix classic.



 
Cooke's winning run finally ends
Dutch rider Adrie Visser wins the third round of the World Cup, Nicole Cooke edged out in the final sprint.



 
Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.








FUN AND GAMES




Ten to tackle
Test your knowledge on the last seven days in sport



 
Stephen Hendry talks to Chris Evans
Snooker star Stephen Hendry talks to Chris Evans about their crazy weekend in Hungary and which snooker player he would take out on a date. Chris and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest every eveing on their Radio 2 show.



 
Quotes of the Week
Patrice Evra on how to stop Ronaldo, plus Roma coach Luciano Spalletti
